Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of COVID-19 testing in the US by stating that it is over $3,000 per test when, in reality, the testing is currently not being billed to patients.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the US is charging over $3,000 per test for COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the experience of one individual, who was not even tested for COVID-19, represents the general cost of testing in the US.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the authorized testing agencies in the US are not currently billing patients for COVID-19 testing.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing accurate information about the cost of COVID-19 testing and not considering the current policies in place.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the high initial cost of the individual's hospital visit, such as the inclusion of testing for other respiratory pathogens.
